== Introduction ==

Hi! I'm Tom and the purpose of this page is to coordinate integration of <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WASCE|WebSphere Application Server Community Edition]]</nowiki> into Ubuntu.  

WASCE has been <nowiki>[[http://www-1.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=2359&uid=swg27006834|supported]]</nowiki> on Ubuntu for some time, but I'm now packaging it as a <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deb_%28file_format%29|deb]]</nowiki>, and want to host it in the <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/community/ubuntustory/components|multiverse]]</nowiki> so its more accessible to Ubuntu users.

== Status ==

WASCE v2.0.0.1 is currently posted to <nowiki>[[http://revu.tauware.de/|REVU]]</nowiki>.  <nowiki>[[http://revu.tauware.de/details.py?package=wasce-2.0|Comments]]</nowiki> welcome!

== Usage ==

 1. Currently, you have to build the WASCE binary out of <nowiki>[[http://revu.tauware.de/details.py?package=wasce-2.0|REVU]]</nowiki>.
 2. Install WASCE using any of your favorite Ubuntu mechanisms.  For example,
** From Nautilus, double-click the WASCE deb to open it with the GDebi Package Installer.
 3. Accept the license to complete the installation wizard.
 4. Point your browser at the package's <nowiki>[[file:///usr/share/doc/wasce-2.0/README.Debian.htm|/usr/share/doc/wasce-2.0/README.Debian.htm]]</nowiki> for further usage instructions. 

== Contacts ==

WASCE/Ubuntu packaging and integration issues should be discussed on the <nowiki>[[http://www-128.ibm.com/developerworks/forums/dw_forum.jsp?forum=541&cat=51|WASCE web forum]]</nowiki>.

Underlying <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_ee#Java_EE_5_certified|Java EE 5]]</nowiki> issues should be discussed on the <nowiki>[[http://www.nabble.com/Apache-Geronimo---Users-f135.html|Apache Geronimo Users web forum]]</nowiki>.

If you really need to speak directly to WASCE, start with <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~trowe-us|Tom Rowe]]</nowiki>.
